author: eth2_gitter_bot
content: <josephdelong> For some research I am doing for Eth2 I need to know the block witness size for stateless Eth1. Can someone help me out? Thanks

author: eth2_gitter_bot
content: <gichiba> Igor will be able to answer if he's got more up to date data but I happen to have this in my notes if you wanted some ballpark figures:

author: eth2_gitter_bot
content: <gichiba> also this one, which might be more what you're looking for: https://medium.com/@mandrigin/stateless-ethereum-binary-tries-experiment-b2c035497768

author: mandrigin
content: Hey! I don't have any new data, and I didn't have plans to do more tests until our witness spec isn't done.

author: mandrigin
content: Otherwise, I will measure something that will change relatively soon.

author: mandrigin
content: But I doubt that the numbers will be that different until we add code merkelization

author: mandrigin
content: btw, I added links to different articles regarded Stateless Ethereum experiments to the readme of the specs repo: https://github.com/ethereum/stateless-ethereum-specs/blob/master/README.md
